title: Track and manage flow runs
content:
This topic gives details on how you can use the RUN EXPLORER tab to track and monitor the progress of a flow(s).

You can perform the following actions on the flow(s) from the RUN EXPLORER tab:

  1. View the basic details of the completed flow(s)
  2. View the advanced details about the flow(s)
  3. Pause the running flow(s)
  4. Resume the paused flow(s)
  5. Reassign the paused flow(s) to another user
  6. Cancel the running flow(s)
  7. Select the flow(s)
  8. Refresh the flow(s)
The display of runs depends on the content permissions granted for your role. You can view only those runs of flows that you have permission for.
The RUN EXPLORER gets auto refreshed. The view gets updated whenever a new run starts or when the run has its status, duration, or user updated.

If you are unable to locate a flow run, you can use the filter capabilities of the RUN EXPLORER to find the flow run that you need.

View basic details about a flow run

  1. Click Run Management to display the workspace.
  2. Click the RUN EXPLORER tab.
  3. View the basic details about each run in a tabular form, such as: 
    1. Information of your flow(s) and those of other users.
    2. The custom name for the flow run that's provided by you instead of the default flow name.

Display advanced details about a flow run

  1. Click the RUN EXPLORER tab.
  2. Select the flow run that you want to look at in detail.

  3. Click the Drill down button at the end of each row to display more information about the selected run. Additionally, you can double-click a row to drill down to see this information. The Drill down button displays only when you select a row in the table.

Pause a flow run

  1. Click the Run Management button to display the Run Management workspace.
  2. Click the RUN EXPLORER tab.
  3. Select one or more flows that are currently running.

  4. Click the Pause button in the RUN EXPLORER toolbar. The run status changes to Pending pause and then to Paused.

    The Pause button is only available if all selected runs are currently running.

    Note also that a run with Pending pause status will get timed out on reaching the set timeout threshold.

Resume the paused flow run.

You can resume a run that has Paused – User Paused status. If your role has the Manage Others' Runs permission, you can resume the runs paused by others. Otherwise, you can resume runs that you paused.

  1. Click the Run Management > RUN EXPLORER tab.
  2. Select one or more paused runs.
  3. If the Resume button is available in the RUN EXPLORER toolbar, click it to resume the run (or runs).

If the Resume button isn't available in the RUN EXPLORER toolbar, this means that you need to interact with the system to complete these runs individually:

  1. Click the Drill down button at the end of the row to display more information about a run.
  2. Click the Expand button to expand the prompt message.
  3. Enter the required information.
  4. Click Resume .
  5. Repeat for the next run that you want to resume. The Resume button is only available if all selected runs are currently paused.

Cancel a flow run

  1. Click the Run Management> RUN EXPLORER tab.
  2. Select one or more flows that are currently running.
  3. Click the Cancel button in the RUN EXPLORER toolbar.
  4. In the confirmation dialog box, click Yes to confirm that you want to cancel the flow run (or runs). The Cancel button is only available if all selected runs are eligible for cancellation: if they're running or paused but not finished.

Select multiple runs

You can perform the following actions on multiple runs: Cancel, Pause, Reassign, and Resume.

To select multiple runs in the RUN EXPLORER:

  • Click the check box next to the header Run Name to select all the flow runs.
  • Click the check box next to each flow run that you want to select individually.
  • Hold down the Shift Key and then click anywhere in the row to select a run:
    • Use Shift Key  to select multiple runs that are adjacent. Select the first run, and then hold the Shift Key while you select the last run.
    • Use Ctrl Key to select multiple runs that aren't adjacent.

Reassign ownership of a flow run

Each run has an owner. By default, this is the person who started the run, but you can change the owner during execution by assigning the run to a different user. You must note that the owner of a run is the user who appears in the User column.

You can reassign multiple runs at the same time.

Reassignment is usually triggered because of a gated transition, where the run has paused because it doesn't have the permission to proceed, or because of a hand off; where the author marked a transition as needing to be handed off to another user. However, you can also reassign a flow at any point in the flow run. If the flow is running, it will get paused so that it can be reassigned. However, reassignment doesn't validate that the reassigned user exists.

If you reassign a flow with the status of Paused – Action Required, note that the assigned user won't be able to resume it via the RUN EXPLORER. The assigned user will need to drill down into the run and resume it from there.

To reassign ownership of a flow run:

  1. Click the Run Management > RUN EXPLORER tab.
  2. Select one or more flows that are currently running or paused.
  3. Click the Reassign button. The Reassign button is available if the selected runs are running or paused.

  4. In the Reassign a Run dialog box, enter the user name of a different user and the domain to which this user belongs.

  5. Click Reassign. If you reassign a run to a non existent user, the reassignment will fail.

The actions that you can perform on flow runs depends on permissions that you have for your role:

  • If your role has the Manage Others' Runs permission, you will be able to perform actions on the runs triggered by all users.
  • If your role doesn't have this permission, you will be able to perform actions on the runs that you have triggered.

Refresh the flow runs

The Refresh  button refreshes the view that's currently below in the RUN EXPLORER, whether this is the run list or the drill down.

  • Click the Refresh button in the RUN EXPLORER tab.

    Note that after you refresh, your selected row gets cleared. You can also refresh the page by pressing F1 on your keyboard, but this loads the entire page. Clicking the Refresh button only refreshes the data display, so this is much faster.

Related topics
